column1: Billy was the old family horse
column4: and loving. Anybody could catch him
column6: or drive him. He liked to be petted
column7: and in return seemed to take pride in being kind to all in the family.Tom was a good horse too; but we had not owned him so long
column8: and he did not care much to have any one pet him.Billy was a little lame; and though he worked everywhere on the farm
column9: and in drawing loads on the road
column10: yet he was generally excused from going with the carriage
column11: except when it was necessary for some of us children to drive.One day my father went to the village with Tom
column13: in a field near the house. He missed his old friend Tom. They had worked together so much
column14: that they had become great friends; and either one was very lonesome without the other.
